lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Although firming oil prices mean better news for Norway, Western Europe's biggest oil producer after Britain, analysts point to high interest rates, uncertainty over the future price of oil and a weighty current account balance of payments deficit as threats to the bourse.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The minority Labour government has looked increasingly stable since it came to power in May, 1986, with the former right-centrist coalition in disarray.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But the attraction for foreign investors of the stock market, where price/earnings ratios average around a relatively low 11, is tempered by restrictions and some nervousness about the future of Norway's economy, analysts say.
